meanings.definition: The behavior or actions of a mischievous or dishonest person.
meanings.sent1: His rascalities at school often got him in trouble with the teachers.
meanings.sent2: The town was tired of the rascalities of the local troublemakers.
meanings.sent3: The rascalities of the playful puppy always brought a smile to our faces.
meanings.sent4: Her rascalities were like a puzzle, always keeping us guessing.
meanings.sent5: The rascalities of the young boy were as clear as day for everyone to see.

meanings.sent1: The magician's rascalities amazed the audience with their cleverness.
meanings.sent2: The con artist's rascalities fooled many unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent3: The rascalities of the sneaky fox were always one step ahead of the farmers.
meanings.sent4: Her rascalities in negotiation were like a well-played game of chess.
meanings.sent5: The rascalities of the scammer were finally exposed by the authorities.
